isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - DESCRIPTION - GAUGE INPUTS

svcprocinfo.para: Signal inputs for the electronic gauges (refer to Electronic Gauges) go to the Speedometer/Tachometer module. The Speedometer/Tachometer module has built-in self test features for the basic cluster circuits, sensor fault detection, and gauges reading out of limits. The source of the signal depends if the engine is electronically controlled or mechanically controlled.

The electrical gauges (refer to Electrical Gauges) receive inputs from standard sensors or gauge senders installed to specifically drive the gauge. These gauges are installed the same with or without electronic engine controls.

svcsubproc.title: With Electronic Engines
svcsubproc.para: With electronic engines, the speedometer, tachometer, engine oil pressure and water temperature gauge information is transmitted over the ATA Data Link from the engine's electronic control module (ECM) to the Speedometer/Tachometer module. The fuel gauge sender inputs to the Speedometer/Tachometer module.
The voltmeter input is from the power supply to the speedometer unit.

svcsubproc.title: With Mechanical Engines
svcsubproc.para: With mechanical engines, the International-installed oil pressure sender, engine water temperature sender, vehicle speed sensor, engine speed sensor, and fuel gauge sender outputs are sent to the Speedometer/Tachometer module.
The voltmeter input is from the power supply to the speedometer unit.
